definitions.definition: a curved piece of glass or plastic that makes things look larger, smaller or clearer when you look through it

examples.text: a pair of glasses with tinted lenses
Put your hand in front of your right lens and just look through your left lens.
She wears glasses with very thick lenses.

definitions.definition: a piece of equipment that is part of a camera, containing one or more lenses

examples.text: a camera with an adjustable lens
a view of Mount Kilimanjaro as seen through Eddie's camera lens
a long-lens shot of a rare bird

definitions.definition: a contact lens (= a small round piece of thin plastic that you put on your eye to help you see better)

examples.text: Have you got your lenses in?

definitions.definition: the clear part of the eye, behind the pupil, that focuses light so that you can see clearly

wordOrigin: late 17th cent.: from Latin, ‘lentil’ (because of the similarity in shape).
